benchmark_details.name: Redeﬁning Simplicity: Benchmarking Large Language Models from Lexical to Document Simpliﬁcation
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents a comprehensive analysis and comparison of LLM performance across four text simplification tasks: lexical, syntactic, sentence, and document simplification, demonstrating that LLMs outperform traditional methods in all tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the performance of large language models in text simplification tasks and benchmark their capabilities across different types of simplification.

data.source: The TSAR-2022 shared task and Newsela dataset consisting of complex and simplified text pairs.
data.size: 1,445,159 pairs for WEBSPLIT dataset, 2,359 sentences for ASSET dataset, and a sampled set of 200 documents from Newsela.

methodology.calculation: Metrics such as SARI and BERTScore are calculated based on the alignment of generated sentences with reference sentences.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in maintaining meaning and simplification.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4o achieves the highest performance across tasks.
methodology.validation: Experimental settings validated using multiple datasets and evaluation metrics.
